title: 820-3115 PM_SLP_S4_L pulsing
message: This 820-3115 came to me dead. I fixed a short on 3V42 and now it has quater fan spin. PP3V3_S5 is stable, PP5V_S3 is pulsing every 5 seconds cause PM_SPL_S4_l is also pulsing. Not really sure where to go from here. Any known suspects like U1950 on 00165? I did replace U7200 and clock ic so far but no change. Thanks in advance.

title: 820-3115 PM_SLP_S4_L pulsing
message:
Check for pulse at all big coils.
ALL_SYS_PWRGD pulsing also?

title: 820-3115 PM_SLP_S4_L pulsing
message:
Thank you. Yes,  ALL_SYS_PWRGD is also pulsing. 
Everything above and 3V3_S5 is stable. 
5V_S3, 1V5_S3, 1V8_S0, CPUVCCIO_S0, VCCSA_S0, PPV, T29BST_BOOST are pulsing.
PPBUS_SW_BKL, PPVCORE_S0, CPUIMVP_S0 are steady 0V (confirmed with scope).
Any rail/coil i forgot thats important?

title: 820-3115 PM_SLP_S4_L pulsing
message:
AVREF_SMC is present?
Test if board stays on in SMC bypass mode.
Be sure R7402/03 are good; resolder them and check the traces too.

title: 820-3115 PM_SLP_S4_L pulsing
message:
AVREF_SMC is 3.3V, steady.
R7402 150,4 kOhm
R7403 182,3 kOhm
I resoldered both.
Both have 12.57V at pin 2 steady and 12,4V at pin 1 pulsing. But i guess thats because 5V supply of U7400 is also pulsing, resetting the IC and Path to GND for TON Pins with every pulse...
In SMC bypass mode i get no green light, 12.3V (as expected) but also no start and pulsing rails.

title: 820-3115 PM_SLP_S4_L pulsing
message:
In SMC bypass, still not pulsing at L7510/20?

Check U7400 pins, 46, 19, 29; should catch pulse at least.

title: 820-3115 PM_SLP_S4_L pulsing
message: In SMC Bypass (12.3V checked) U7400 pins, 46, 19, 29 are pulsing, as in "normal" mode before. And L7510, L7520 still steady 0V on my scope, no pulse.

title: 820-3115 PM_SLP_S4_L pulsing
message:
Try known good BIOS.
If still the same, then bad PCH, or CPU.

title: 820-3115 PM_SLP_S4_L pulsing
message: Sadly the bios also did not fix it. I used the IC i made for the same board in my other thread. I dont think thats the programming but do you have a known good file for me - just in case my "good" somehow is not wotking correctly?

title: 820-3115 PM_SLP_S4_L pulsing
message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IOFCJ4xJPzjcywY867UE23yfRe_fm9UB/view?usp=share_link[/URL]
If still the same, try heating PCH and CPU with quality flux; in case of accumulated crap underneath.

title: 820-3115 PM_SLP_S4_L pulsing
message: Thank you. Ill see what i can do.
